bibl.title: Letter from Edmond I. Souchon to Henry Rose Carter, September 9, 1898

div1.p: On behalf of the city of New Orleans, Souchon thanks Carter for his assistance.

div1.head: Letter from Edmond I. Souchon to Henry Rose Carter, September 9, 1898
div1.opener:
BOARD OF HEALTH
EDMOND SOUCHON, M.D.
-:PRESIDENT.:-
G. FARRAR PATTON, M.D.
-:SECRETARY.:-
STATE OF LOUISIANA.
COR.CARONDELET AND COMMON STS.
J.J. Hooper, N.O.
New Orleans, September 9th., 1898.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
Surg. U. S. M. H. S.,
Dear Doctor :-
div1.p:
Once more it is my happy lot to express to you my heartfelt
gratitude for the invaluable assistance you have rendered me and this great
city in the momentous ordeal which it has undergone a few days ago.

No one realizes more than I the purity of your character and knows
that the verdict you rendered was dictated wholly by your high sense of
honor and justice.

I am also fully aware that like the historic Bayard, you are without
fear and without reproach, and that, had you believed differently, you
would have so expressed yourself.

It must be a source of unbounded gratification to the M.H.S. to be
instrumental in doing so much good through such men as you who honor the
Service as much as it is honored by it.
div1.closer:
Believe me as ever and forever,
Your true friend, Edmond Souchon M.D. President Louisiana State Board of Health.
